Luciana Berger was parachuted into a safe seat in Liverpool by the Blair machine, over the heads of the CLP and local candidates who'd spent years working in Wavertree community politics. Berger had no connection with Liverpool - she was a London New Labour Careerist, hand-picked by Blair. She now falls back on comfortable claim that the local CLP is anti-Semitic because they don't like her very much. She resigned from the Labour Party because she was about to be deselected. Berger's absurd line appears to be: 'If you don't vote for me you're an an anti-Semite'. Doesn't it occur to Ms Berger that all Palestinians are Semites? Yet she has not once spoken as an MP in the Commons about the slaughter of Palestinians in Gaza,  never once protested on the streets of London over, for example, the Israeli war on Lebanon, or the Israeli use of phosphorous bombs on the population of the West Bank. For Luciana it is all about: 'Poor me'.
